1248698940670857217.text:
Will my loan be forgiven?

The loan amounts will be forgiven as long as:
 
✅The loan proceeds are used to cover payroll costs, and most mortgage interest, rent, and utility costs over the 8 week period after the loan is made
✅Employee and compensation levels are maintained

1248698939852947463.text:
How large can my loan be?
 
▶️Loans can be for up to two months of your average monthly payroll costs from the last year plus an additional 25% of that amount.
▶️Please note, that amount is subject to a $10 million cap.

1248698938787606532.text:
What can I use these loans for?
 
💰Payroll costs, including benefits
🏦Interest on mortgage obligations, incurred before February 15, 2020
🏣Rent, under lease agreements in force before February 15, 2020
💡Utilities, for which service began before February 15, 2020

1248698937965522944.text:
Who can apply?
 
Any business with 500 or fewer employees can apply, including:

✅Nonprofits
✅Veterans organizations
✅Tribal business concerns
✅Sole proprietorships
✅Self-employed individuals
✅Independent contractors

1090748987945172992.text: Both offer new opportunities to protect women from unfair and unjust discrimination. Though we've made strides, we still need an amendment to enshrine the rights we deserve.

1090748987328659461.text: That's why I have signed on to two resolutions -- one that would repeal the expired deadline for the original ERA, and another that creates a modified version of the ERA that explicitly guarantees equal rights for men and women.

1090748986699460609.text: The push to ratify the #EqualRightsAmendment (ERA) was a bold effort to expand women's rights across America. But sadly, it wasn't ratified in time by enough states to become law of the land. 37 years after it missed the mark, its protections are still needed.
